reg:regulation.reg:title: Commissioners for Taking Affidavits for British Columbia Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Commissioners because of office or employment
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following classes of office holder or employment are prescribed for the purposes of section 60 (l) of the Evidence Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: articled students within the meaning of the Legal Profession Act;
persons enrolled in temporary articles under the rules made under section 11 of the Legal Profession Act;
police constables who are appointed under section 44 of the Railway Safety Act (Canada) and are located in British Columbia;
family justice counsellors appointed under section 10 of the Family Law Act;
child support officers and local managers employed in the Family Justice Services Division of the Justice Services Branch of the Ministry of Attorney General;
family maintenance workers and family maintenance supervisors employed in the Ministry of Social Development and Social Innovation;
family search officers, managers and directors employed in the Maintenance Enforcement and Locate Services Division of the Justice Services Branch of the Ministry of Attorney General;
customer service representatives and senior customer service representatives employed in the Service BC division of the Ministry of Technology, Innovation and Citizens' Services;
local managers, regional managers, assistant deputy wardens, deputy wardens, wardens, deputy provincial directors and provincial directors employed by BC Corrections;
registrar as defined in the Court of Appeal Act.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Evidence Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 124, s. 60 (1).]
